availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry J. Simpson (Pulaski County, Kentucky, carpenter)

body.p: Pulaski County, Kentucky, carpenter. Orange County, North Carolina, native. Son of Lemuel W. Simpson and Lucy Faucett Simpson. Married to Elizabeth H. Ellis Simpson in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on November 17, 1860. Married to Mariah Cox Simpson in Pulaski County, Kentucky, on November 17, 1863. Resident of Alamance County, North Carolina, in 1850. Resident of Pulaski County, Kentucky, in 1860. Carpenter in Pulaski County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, North Carolina, Alamance County, North District, p. 81B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, District 1, p. 220.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Pulaski County, KY, August to September 1863, p. 344.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994053, Pulaski County Marriages, p. 171.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994053, Pulaski County Marriages.
North Carolina Marriage Bonds - Abstracts, 1760-1957, North Carolina State Archives, Raleigh, NC, RG 048, Orange County, p. 367.
